title: FIND WORD ALLL NITE
license: Open source under the GPL-3.0-only license https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.html
description: Uncover hidden words in a world-wide real-time vocabulary roguelike.

DEC_TO_HEX.description: Convert base 10 number to base 16 string. We use this to assign a unique character to each tile when searching for words, so that a string is a path through the board.

HEX_TO_DEC.description: Convert single digit base 36 string to base 10 number. See also `DECIMAL_TO_BASE36`.

xp_rect.description: XP bar outline within its set_transform area

unique_word_per_tile.description: The first two letters don't count

LEVEL_EXPONENT.description: See `xp_to_level()`. Higher is easier to level up. Chosen to make Level 20 ~= 40k XP

NAME_ALPHABET.description: Legal letters in an avatar name. Names are also run through a sensitive check before being displayed.

CONNECT_TIME_SECONDS.description: Time in seconds to connect into the network before the game ends, so that everyone is exchange word lists on game end.

CONNECT_MAX_DELAY_SECONDS.description: Within the NETWORK_CONNECT_TIME window, what is the maximum time to randomly delay so that all nodes aren't competing to connect at exactly the same moment.

SHUFFLE_RETRIES.description: How many times to shuffle a given board trying to find a way to satisfy the other constraints. Making this high avoids affecting letter distribution while still improving board quality.

MIN_VALUABLE_LETTER_USES.description: How many times every good letter (such as Q) must be used in words. -ER, -S, -ED, -ING, RE-, UN-, end up amplifying this in some cases, so the words might not be very different.

MIN_VALUABLE_LETTER_LONG_WORDS.description: How many times every good letter (such as Q) must be used in 5+ letter words . -ER, -S, -ED, -ING, RE-, UN-, end up amplifying this in some cases, so the words might not be very different.

MEAN_VALUABLE_LETTER_USES.description: How many times good letters (such as Q) must be used in words on average. -ER, -S, -ED, -ING, RE-, UN-, end up amplifying this in some cases, so the words might not be very different.

MEAN_VALUABLE_LETTER_LONG_WORDS.description: How many times good letters (such as Q) must be used in 5+ letter words on average. -ER, -S, -ED, -ING, RE-, UN-, end up amplifying this in some cases, so the words might not be very different.

CRITERIA.description: Options for controlling the search for a good board in `player_reset()`

LETTER_SET_ARRAY.description: Individual distributions when using the cube algorithm. Choice of letters is constrained by selecting from each of these individual distributions.

LETTER_BAG.description: Bag for drawing from when using the bag algorithm for board generation. Note that we need enough of each letter to support words with multiples but don't want to have so many that our 16-tile board becomes filled with repeats. There are almost no words with two X's, so we give only one

REMAP_SECONDS.description: Amount of distorted time to remap. I.e., remapping starts when this time is displayed

END_TIME_SCALE.description: How much to scale time after the pivot (< 100% = slower)

LETTER_POINT_TABLE.description: Points per letter. This is similar to other word games but increases the score for some really difficult to use letters.

HIGH_POINTS.description: Highest points per word that has a unique color in the history

LOW_POINTS.description: Lowest points per word that has a unique color in the history

COLOR.description: Four color points for discontinuous super low, normal low, normal high, and discontinuous super high

HOLE_COLOR.description: Color of the hole left when a tile is used in Free Mode

CENTER_SELECTED_COLOR.description: Default selection gray. This is replaced by custom colors as increasingly valuable words are found. See `player_add_to_history()`

JOIN_MIN_REMAINING_TIME.description: Amount of time in seconds that must be left in a game to permit joining it vs. going to the WaitingRoom

PLAY_SECONDS.description: Game time. Has to be long enough that it doesn't immediately restart from the intermission when debugging.

ALPHABET.description: The alphabet as a lowercase string.

EXTRA.description: Words to add to the dictionary even though they violate some technical rule, such as capitalization. Must be pre-Q-encoded

MIN_WORD_LENGTH.description: In tiles (not letters: Qu is one tile)

MAX_WORD_LENGTH.description: Longest possible word, including using wild tile

DELAY.description: How long in frames to wait for a held touch/button press to repeat

PERIOD.description: Frames to wait after BUTTON_REPEAT_DELAY for each subsequent touch/button repeat

LOOKS_LIKE.description: Common number substitutions used to thwart keyword safety checks

GATHER_SECONDS.description: How many seconds GatherGlobalResults runs for

REBOOT_TIME_MINUTES.description: If the game has been asleep for longer than this restart on wake intead of unpausing

MOST_WORDS_AWARD_FRAMES_PER_WORD.description: Applies to both most_rare and most_words awards

SECONDS.description: Time between global games. The total game period is INTERMISSION.SECONDS + 60 GLOBAL_GAME_TIME_MINUTES exactly

WIDTH.description: In pixels. Forces the award width

HISTORY_PORTRAIT_HEIGHT.description: Height of the history in portrait mode

AWARD_HEIGHT.description: In pixels. Forces the leaderboard height

MZK.description: Bot that is good with using the letter K

aura_test_bot.description: Test bot added when DEBUG.AURA = true

BOO.description: Bot that is good with scary ghost words

ID.description: Must be kept in sync with MOO.descriptor.name

PORTRAIT.description: Debug override this to true to force a mobile-device-like aspect ratio in the IDE

OFFLINE.description: Do not actually share results online if true

FORCE_LEVEL.description: If non-zero, forces the player to this level

TUTORIAL.description: Properties affecting the tutorials throughout the game with arrow popups and the first game tutorial experience.

FIRST_TIME_BOARD.description: The board used for the player's first game ever. Designed to be easy. Do not change without modifying the achievements needed to complete the first match.

SOLO_GAME.descriptions: Constants for the SOLO game type

GRACE_SECONDS.description: Time to allow input while hiding the screen for Play and Freestyle modes.
